conclusion: Predicting which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.
Analyzing the liquid flow paths from sources A, B, C, and D to determine their final destinations.
The orange liquid starts at the top-left position (Source A).
In the simulation image, the orange liquid flows down and hits the yellow diagonal baffle.
The orange liquid follows along the yellow baffle toward the bottom-left.
After leaving the yellow baffle, the orange liquid continues toward the bottom-left of the board.
The orange liquid ultimately flows into the leftmost house-shaped container (E).
The green liquid starts at the second position from the left (Source B).
The green liquid flows straight down until it reaches the yellow diagonal baffle.
Upon hitting the yellow baffle, the green liquid flows along it toward the left.
The simulation shows green liquid mixing with other colors and flowing toward the left side.
The green liquid ultimately flows into the leftmost container (E).
The blue liquid starts at the third position from the left (Source C).
The blue liquid flows straight down until it hits the yellow diagonal baffle.
The simulation shows the blue liquid following the same path as A and B.
The blue liquid moves along the yellow baffle toward the left.
The blue liquid ultimately flows into the leftmost container (E).
The yellow liquid starts at the rightmost position (Source D).
In the simulation, the yellow liquid flows straight down.
The yellow liquid appears to pass by the gray baffle without significant deviation.
The yellow liquid continues downward with some dotted pattern visible in the simulation.
The yellow liquid eventually flows into container F (the second house from the right).
The simulation image shows the orange, green, and blue liquids converging along the yellow diagonal baffle toward the left.
